message: FreeBSD 9 (and possibly 8.2, though unlikely) will include EC2 support
i'm also praying for the day ec2 comes around
using apt-get makes me super sad
http://www.rootbsd.net/
I'd like to move away from rackspace cloud and have been itching to try FreeBSD (for jails). Cheap is good. Reliable is better.
@justinlilly If you can wait a bit you'll be able to use EC2
i was -this- close to doing rootbsd but went with linode instead. can you attest to it curt?
How inexpensive is hosting something small on ec2? I actually haven't priced it recently.
ie: micro instance / month?
justinlilly: it's cheap but unpredictable.
@jacob I know a lot of people who have them, seem to be good. But I host all of my stuff here: http://genesishosting.com/services/fixed_resource.cfm
Unpredictable how? Bandwidth?
basically yeah
@jacob compared to EC2 yes, but it provides me more options.
though $25/mth for their service hasn't been a waste of money, very happy.
just seems like the resouce allocation for the 25 seems fairly low
Soon I'll have a setup for bootstrapping a FreeBSD server with puppet published. Taking me sometime though
this should probably be it's own topic huh
CPU, micros basically fill in the gaps of performance on the hosts
The cool thing about Genesis is they give you a resource group and you can create a bunch of vm's, or one. Great for experimenting with things

that's my main issue with linux packaging. it seems like it's a one-shot ordeal, and tinkering around (though obviously possible if it wasn't for my ignorance) isn't as intuitive as it is in *Bsd land
@jacob for the reliability, it's blown away RSC and EC2 in my experience.
asenchi: this stuff looks kinda expensive, or am i reading it wrong?
It's also the only VMware provider I can find that does this (and is reliable)
i just moved nohomers.net (php =() to linode and have been crazy happy with it, even if setting up the boxes was an ordeal
topic forked
asenchi: what's your thoughts on puppet vs chef for bsd support?
hehe sure
My beef with RSC is that I got ~$5 in affiliate credit, 3 months later, they charge me 3 dollars randomly, revoking my affiliate credit, because of some reason they wouldn't tell me.
@justinlilly eesh
Check out arpnetworks.com.. recently moved off of Rackspace to a few fbsd vps here. So far, excellent service and the owner and staff are usually available on their IRC channel (freenode)
I have a small FreeBSD VPS at hetzner.de (~$12) and a very small one at nqhost.com (~$6). I am quite happy with both, though I don't have anything performance or mission critical there.
